column4: anyone got a quick suggestion on getting an on board lan to work with ubuntu from an old compaq presario 5600i
if it doesn't work out of the box it may take some fiddling
1st use 'lspci' to find out if the card's recognisable, then check in /var/log/messages for the kernel loading a driver
did a driver load? does ifconfig eth0 up work?
does ifconfig now show eth0 up with no ip?
perfect - edit /etc/network/interfaces for eth0 to suit & you're in business
check your autoneg settings with 'sudo mii-tool eth0'
check your autoneg settings with 'sudo mii-tool eth0'
i ran that command and it returns "eth0: 100Mbit, half duplex, no link"
k, now plug this machine into the router - to test the router nic
if you can disable autonegotiatoin on the router port, & set it to 100baseTx-FD
